ai-mn47:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn47:2.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant who is an inquirer, unable to comprehend another’s mind, should scrutinize the Realized One to see whether he is a fully awakened Buddha or not.”
ai-mn47:3.1_0: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. He is our guide and our refuge.
ai-mn47:3.1_1: He is our guide and our refuge.
ai-mn47:3.1_2: Sir, may the Buddha himself please clarify the meaning of this. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”
ai-mn47:3.2_0: “Well then, mendicants, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-mn47:4.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant who is an inquirer, unable to comprehend another’s mind, should scrutinize the Realized One for two things—things that can be seen and heard:
ai-mn47:4.2_0: ‘Nothing corrupt can be seen or heard in the Realized One?’
ai-mn47:4.4_0: nothing corrupt can be seen or heard in the Realized One.
ai-mn47:5.3_0: ‘Nothing mixed can be seen or heard in the Realized One?’
ai-mn47:5.5_0: nothing mixed can be seen or heard in the Realized One.
ai-mn47:6.3_0: clean things can be seen or heard in the Realized One?’
ai-mn47:6.5_0: clean things can be seen and heard in the Realized One.
ai-mn47:7.3_0: ‘Did the venerable attain this skillful state a long time ago, or just recently?’
ai-mn47:7.5_0: the venerable attained this skillful state a long time ago, not just recently.
ai-mn47:8.3_0: ‘Are certain dangers found in that venerable mendicant who has achieved fame and renown?’
ai-mn47:8.4_0: Even though a mendicant has not found fame and renown.
ai-mn47:8.5_0: But when they achieve fame and renown, those dangers appear.
ai-mn47:8.7_0: ‘A mendicant who has achieved fame and renown.’
ai-mn47:9.3_0: ‘Is this venerable securely stopped or insecurely stopped?
ai-mn47:9.4_0: Is the reason they don’t indulge in sensual pleasures that they’re free of greed because greed has ended?’
ai-mn47:9.6_0: ‘Is this venerable securely stopped or insecurely stopped?
ai-mn47:9.7_0: The reason they don’t indulge in sensual pleasures is that they’re free of greed because greed has ended.
ai-mn47:10.1_0: If others should ask that mendicant:
ai-mn47:10.4_0: The reason they don’t indulge in sensual pleasures is that they’re free of greed because greed has ended.
ai-mn47:10.6_0: ‘Because, whether that venerable is staying in a community or alone, some people there are in a good state or a sorry state, some instruct a group, and some indulge in material pleasures, while others remain unsullied. Yet that venerable doesn’t look down on them for that.
ai-mn47:10.7_0: Also, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-mn47:10.8_0: “I am securely stopped, not insecurely stopped. The reason I don’t indulge in sensual pleasures is that I’m free of greed because greed has ended.”’
ai-mn47:11.1_0: Next, they should ask the Realized One himself about this,
ai-mn47:11.2_0: ‘Nothing corrupt can be seen or heard in the Realized One?’
ai-mn47:11.3_0: Answering in this way, the Realized One would answer:
ai-mn47:11.4_0: nothing corrupt can be seen or heard in the Realized One.
ai-mn47:12.1_0: ‘Nothing mixed can be seen or heard in the Realized One?’
ai-mn47:12.2_0: Answering in this way, the Realized One would answer:
ai-mn47:12.3_0: nothing mixed can be seen or heard in the Realized One.
ai-mn47:13.1_0: clean things can be seen or heard in the Realized One?’
ai-mn47:13.2_0: Answering in this way, the Realized One would answer:
ai-mn47:13.3_0: ‘Clean things can be seen and heard in the Realized One.
ai-mn47:13.4_0: I am that range and that territory, but I do not identify with that.’
ai-mn47:14.1_0: A disciple ought to approach a teacher who has such a doctrine in order to listen to the teaching.
ai-mn47:14.2_0: The teacher explains Dhamma with its higher and higher stages, with its better and better stages, with its dark and bright sides.
ai-mn47:14.3_0: When they directly know a certain principle of those teachings, in accordance with how they were taught, the mendicant comes to a conclusion about the teachings. They have confidence in the teacher:
ai-mn47:14.4_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha! The teaching is well explained! The Saṅgha is practicing well!’
ai-mn47:15.1_0: If others should ask that mendicant:
ai-mn47:15.3_0: “The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha! The teaching is well explained! The Saṅgha is practicing well!”’
ai-mn47:15.5_0: ‘Reverends, I approached the Buddha to listen to the teaching.
ai-mn47:15.6_0: He explained Dhamma with its higher and higher stages, with its better and better stages, with its dark and bright sides.
ai-mn47:15.7_0: When I directly knew a certain principle of those teachings, in accordance with how I was taught, I came to a conclusion about the teachings. I had confidence in the Teacher:
ai-mn47:15.8_0: “The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha! The teaching is well explained! The Saṅgha is practicing well!”’
ai-mn47:16.1_0: When someone’s faith is settled, rooted, and planted in the Realized One in this manner, with these words and phrases, it’s said to be grounded faith that’s based on evidence.
ai-mn47:16.2_0: It is firm, and cannot be shifted by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.
ai-mn47:16.3_0: This is how to scrutinize the Realized One’s qualities.
ai-mn47:16.4_0: But the Realized One has already been properly searched in this way by nature.”
ai-mn47:16.5_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn47:16.6_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn47:16.7_0: The seventh section on the mission is finished.
